info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 7 at 9:38AM CDT until September 7 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bandera, Edwards, Kinney, Medina, Real and Uvalde.
* WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocksprings, Leakey, Vanderpool, Camp Wood, Tuff, Vance, Barksdale, Rio Frio, Garner State Park, Reagan Wells, Montell, Lost Maples State Natural Area, Concan, Laguna, Utopia, Prade Ranch and Devil's Sinkhole State Natural Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Bandera, TX; Edwards, TX; Kinney, TX; Medina, TX; Real, TX; Uvalde, TX
